rows.story_text:
Fati was a little girl who ran like the wind.

She loved to laugh, and always tried hard to do as she was told.

story_text.eng:
Fati was a little girl who ran like the wind.

She loved to laugh, and always tried hard to do as she was told.

annotation_1.eng: It can be hard sometimes to do what you are told. Are you good at following directions?

annotation_2.eng: How do you feel when you don't do as you are told?

annotation_3.eng: Does Fati have more, or less,  limbs (arms and legs) than there are ends to her stick?

rows.annotation_1: It can be hard sometimes to do what you are told. Are you good at following directions?
rows.annotation_2: How do you feel when you don't do as you are told?
rows.annotation_3: Does Fati have more, or less,  limbs (arms and legs) than there are ends to her stick?

rows.story_text: One day, Fati went with her mother and father to look for firewood.

story_text.eng: One day, Fati went with her mother and father to look for firewood.

annotation_1.eng: Have you ever tried to balance something on your head the way Fati's mother is doing? What sorts of things do people carry on their heads?

annotation_2.eng: Looking at Fati's head and shoulders, what do you think she is feeling?

annotation_3.eng: Count together the people in this picture.

rows.annotation_1: Have you ever tried to balance something on your head the way Fati's mother is doing? What sorts of things do people carry on their heads?
rows.annotation_2: Looking at Fati's head and shoulders, what do you think she is feeling?
rows.annotation_3: Count together the people in this picture.

rows.story_text:
Fati liked to help her mother and father, but there was so much to do and so much to see.

There were birds, monkeys, and the sky!

story_text.eng:
Fati liked to help her mother and father, but there was so much to do and so much to see.

There were birds, monkeys, and the sky!

annotation_1.eng: When you are outside, what do you like to look at in the sky?

annotation_2.eng: How many birds is Fati looking at?

annotation_3.eng: Count together all the ends of the sticks in this picture.

rows.annotation_1: When you are outside, what do you like to look at in the sky?
rows.annotation_2: How many birds is Fati looking at?
rows.annotation_3: Count together all the ends of the sticks in this picture.

rows.story_text: Mother said, "Fati, please listen! You can look for firewood here and you can look for firewood there."

story_text.eng: Mother said, "Fati, please listen! You can look for firewood here and you can look for firewood there."

annotation_1.eng: Fati and her mother are holding outdoor tools. Have you used tools, such as a broom, to do work outside?

annotation_2.eng: Fati's mother's dress has a design on it. Count together how many times the design is repeated. Can you count that high? If not, count just one leg.

annotation_3.eng: Two people have a total of two heads. Together, how many legs, arms, eyes, and ears do these two people have?

rows.annotation_1: Fati and her mother are holding outdoor tools. Have you used tools, such as a broom, to do work outside?
rows.annotation_2: Fati's mother's dress has a design on it. Count together how many times the design is repeated. Can you count that high? If not, count just one leg.
rows.annotation_3: Two people have a total of two heads. Together, how many legs, arms, eyes, and ears do these two people have?

rows.story_text:
But Fati, please watch where you go and be very careful."

She replied, "Yes, mother."

story_text.eng:
But Fati, please watch where you go and be very careful."

She replied, "Yes, mother."

annotation_1.eng: What kinds of things might be dangerous for Fati while out collecting firewood?

annotation_2.eng: Which sorts of things are you warned to be careful about?

annotation_3.eng: Do you listen to those warnings? Do you think Fati will listen?

rows.annotation_1: What kinds of things might be dangerous for Fati while out collecting firewood?
rows.annotation_2: Which sorts of things are you warned to be careful about?
rows.annotation_3: Do you listen to those warnings? Do you think Fati will listen?

rows.story_text: Soon Fati's mother and father were very busy.

story_text.eng: Soon Fati's mother and father were very busy.

annotation_1.eng: There are many reasons people wear hats. Why is Fati's father wearing a hat?

annotation_2.eng: Fati's father uses a hat to work outside in the sun. Can you think of other clothes that have special uses for certain occasions?

annotation_3.eng: Fati's family is gathering firewood. Other than keeping warm, what are some ways people use fires?

rows.annotation_1: There are many reasons people wear hats. Why is Fati's father wearing a hat?
rows.annotation_2: Fati's father uses a hat to work outside in the sun. Can you think of other clothes that have special uses for certain occasions?
rows.annotation_3: Fati's family is gathering firewood. Other than keeping warm, what are some ways people use fires?

rows.story_text:
They found big pieces of firewood.

They found small pieces of firewood.

story_text.eng:
They found big pieces of firewood.

They found small pieces of firewood.

annotation_1.eng: Do the different sizes of firewood have different uses?

annotation_2.eng: Count how many pieces of firewood there are.

annotation_3.eng: Compare the thickness of the biggest pieces of firewood to Fati's father's leg. Which is wider and which is narrower?

rows.annotation_1: Do the different sizes of firewood have different uses?
rows.annotation_2: Count how many pieces of firewood there are.
rows.annotation_3: Compare the thickness of the biggest pieces of firewood to Fati's father's leg. Which is wider and which is narrower?

rows.story_text:
Fati was also very busy.

She found small pieces of firewood.

She found very small pieces of firewood.

story_text.eng:
Fati was also very busy.

She found small pieces of firewood.

She found very small pieces of firewood.

annotation_1.eng: Why do you think Fati found such small pieces of firewood?

annotation_2.eng: In making a fire, having a variety of sizes of wood is useful. The small pieces help get the fire going, and the big pieces can make it last a long time.

annotation_3.eng: Count together how many pieces of firewood Fati has found. It's tricky to tell because her wood is all jumbled together.

rows.annotation_1: Why do you think Fati found such small pieces of firewood?
rows.annotation_2: In making a fire, having a variety of sizes of wood is useful. The small pieces help get the fire going, and the big pieces can make it last a long time.
rows.annotation_3: Count together how many pieces of firewood Fati has found. It's tricky to tell because her wood is all jumbled together.

rows.story_text:
Then Fati looked up.

She saw a red bird in the tall grass.

story_text.eng:
Then Fati looked up.

She saw a red bird in the tall grass.

annotation_1.eng: Lots of animals have things in common, such as a mouth and a heart. Guess what birds have that no other animal has. (feathers)

annotation_2.eng: Fati is having too much fun looking at special things to worry about looking for dangers. Is she being careless?

annotation_3.eng: Does the bird's red color blend in with the colors in the tall grass?

rows.annotation_1: Lots of animals have things in common, such as a mouth and a heart. Guess what birds have that no other animal has. (feathers)
rows.annotation_2: Fati is having too much fun looking at special things to worry about looking for dangers. Is she being careless?
rows.annotation_3: Does the bird's red color blend in with the colors in the tall grass?

rows.story_text:
Next, Fati looked down.

She saw a brown ant on the dusty path.

story_text.eng:
Next, Fati looked down.

She saw a brown ant on the dusty path.

annotation_1.eng: The largest ants are about the same length as your finger. Do you think the artist got a little carried away drawing this ant?

annotation_2.eng: Ants have six legs. How many legs does this ant have?

annotation_3.eng: If ants should have six legs, how many legs is this ant missing?

rows.annotation_1: The largest ants are about the same length as your finger. Do you think the artist got a little carried away drawing this ant?
rows.annotation_2: Ants have six legs. How many legs does this ant have?
rows.annotation_3: If ants should have six legs, how many legs is this ant missing?

rows.story_text:
Fati saw a beautiful leaf. The leaf was shiny and green.

She put one finger on the beautiful leaf.

story_text.eng:
Fati saw a beautiful leaf. The leaf was shiny and green.

She put one finger on the beautiful leaf.

annotation_1.eng: What do you think will happen next with this strange leaf?

annotation_2.eng: What is different about the "leaf" that Fati is touching?

annotation_3.eng: An estimate is an educated guess. Make an estimate of how many leaves are in this picture. Is it a number bigger than you know?

rows.annotation_1: What do you think will happen next with this strange leaf?
rows.annotation_2: What is different about the "leaf" that Fati is touching?
rows.annotation_3: An estimate is an educated guess. Make an estimate of how many leaves are in this picture. Is it a number bigger than you know?

rows.story_text:
Fati said, "This does not feel like a leaf."

Suddenly, the beautiful leaf moved!

Fati said, "This is not a beautiful leaf. This is a green snake!"

story_text.eng:
Fati said, "This does not feel like a leaf."

Suddenly, the beautiful leaf moved!

Fati said, "This is not a beautiful leaf. This is a green snake!"

annotation_1.eng: Which of her five senses did Fati use to notice the snake?

annotation_2.eng: If you remove one of the five senses, how many are left?

annotation_3.eng: Can you name all five of your senses?

rows.annotation_1: Which of her five senses did Fati use to notice the snake?
rows.annotation_2: If you remove one of the five senses, how many are left?
rows.annotation_3: Can you name all five of your senses?

rows.story_text:
Fati screamed, "EII!"

She ran very fast to look for her mother and father.

story_text.eng:
Fati screamed, "EII!"

She ran very fast to look for her mother and father.

annotation_1.eng: Fati screamed and ran. When you are surprised and scared, what do you do?

annotation_2.eng: Do you like to hide in your bed or maybe under your bed? What is your favorite hiding spot?

annotation_3.eng: Fati is running so fast that she doesn't notice something. What is it?

rows.annotation_1: Fati screamed and ran. When you are surprised and scared, what do you do?
rows.annotation_2: Do you like to hide in your bed or maybe under your bed? What is your favorite hiding spot?
rows.annotation_3: Fati is running so fast that she doesn't notice something. What is it?

rows.story_text:
Fati saw her father and shouted, "A snake! A snake!"

Father said, "Where? Where?"

Fati said, "There! There!"

story_text.eng:
Fati saw her father and shouted, "A snake! A snake!"

Father said, "Where? Where?"

Fati said, "There! There!"

annotation_1.eng: Do you think her father is angry that she wondered away, happy that she is okay, or both?

annotation_2.eng: Her father has two shoes. How many shoes does Fati have and how many is she missing?

annotation_3.eng: Together they have one more shoe than her father has. What is one more than two?

rows.annotation_1: Do you think her father is angry that she wondered away, happy that she is okay, or both?
rows.annotation_2: Her father has two shoes. How many shoes does Fati have and how many is she missing?
rows.annotation_3: Together they have one more shoe than her father has. What is one more than two?

rows.story_text:
Then her father chased the green snake with a stick.

The green snake slithered away.

story_text.eng:
Then her father chased the green snake with a stick.

The green snake slithered away.

annotation_1.eng: Have you ever seen a snake outside on the ground or in a bush?

annotation_2.eng: Some snakes are very dangerous, and many others are safe. Do some snakes do good things?

annotation_3.eng: What do you know about snakes?

rows.annotation_1: Have you ever seen a snake outside on the ground or in a bush?
rows.annotation_2: Some snakes are very dangerous, and many others are safe. Do some snakes do good things?
rows.annotation_3: What do you know about snakes?

rows.story_text:
Father said, "Fati, you are safe."

Let's go to mother and tell her about the green snake."

story_text.eng:
Father said, "Fati, you are safe."

Let's go to mother and tell her about the green snake."

annotation_1.eng: What are Fati and her father feeling in this picture?

annotation_2.eng: What do you think her mother will say?

annotation_3.eng: Fati got back her other shoe. Now she and her father have one more than three shoes. How many shoes is that?

rows.annotation_1: What are Fati and her father feeling in this picture?
rows.annotation_2: What do you think her mother will say?
rows.annotation_3: Fati got back her other shoe. Now she and her father have one more than three shoes. How many shoes is that?

rows.story_text: Mother said, "Fati, I am happy the green snake did not bite you."

story_text.eng: Mother said, "Fati, I am happy the green snake did not bite you."

annotation_1.eng: Are you surprised that her mother is not angry?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the number of many kinds of things in this picture.

annotation_3.eng: Are there more pants or dresses? Are there more sandals or boots?

rows.annotation_1: Are you surprised that her mother is not angry?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the number of many kinds of things in this picture.
rows.annotation_3: Are there more pants or dresses? Are there more sandals or boots?

rows.story_text:
But next time, please, look where you go, and be more careful.

And that was the end of that.

story_text.eng:
But next time, please, look where you go, and be more careful.

And that was the end of that.

annotation_1.eng: What does the story mean by "And that was the end of that." ?

annotation_2.eng: The three of them have three pairs of shoes. How many is that?

annotation_3.eng: You can count all their shoes by counting by 2's -- 2, 4, 6. Or, you could think of it as twice the number of people -- 3, 6. Which way is easier for you?

rows.annotation_1: What does the story mean by "And that was the end of that." ?
rows.annotation_2: The three of them have three pairs of shoes. How many is that?
rows.annotation_3: You can count all their shoes by counting by 2's -- 2, 4, 6. Or, you could think of it as twice the number of people -- 3, 6. Which way is easier for you?
